bibl.title: Telegram from [Janet and William Butsch] to Philip Showalter Hench, [October 1940]

div1.head: Telegram from [Janet and William Butsch] to Philip Showalter Hench, [October 1940]
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
1201
(41)
R. B. WHITE
PRESIDENT
NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
J. C. WILLEVER
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
GAT4 69 NT=BUFFALO NY 25
DR AND MRS PHILIP S HENCH=
div1.p:
DONT PHONE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON UNIVERSITY WASHINGTON PENN=
AMID DARKLING THREATS OF WAR AND CRIES OF POLITICAL STRIFE
WE ARE THANKFUL THAT IN A STRONG HOLD OF INVINCIBLE TRUTH
A MANLY BROW NO STRANGER HO THE LAUREL IS TO BE WREATHER
AGAIN. SHALL THINK OF YOU OFTEN TODAY AND VERY MUCH MISS
NOT SEEING YOU STOP WE CONGRATULATE MRS H ON HER RUSE IN
GETTING HERWANDERING BOY HOME WE SHALL CONTACT THE
UNIVERSITY OF BUFFALO=
div1.closer:
A FORMER HELPER AND HIS HELPER.
Janet & Wm Butsch THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
